description:
Renewal of planning permission 89/1853 of 30th August, 1990, for erection of basement and six storey building (7,050 square metres) for Class B1 (business) use. 

 APPLICANTS PLAN NOS.  4655/1A; 105/01A, 02D, 03B, 04A, 05A, 06A, 07, 08C; AL(0) SK09; 3201/A/L/(0)/002J, 003H, 004G, 005G, 006G, 007G, 008H, 009G, 010E, 011C, 012D, 013B.
decision: Called in by Secretary of State
site_name: Demolished Building -Currently Used As A Carpark
decision_conditions: REASON: Renewing permission 89/1853 is likely to conflict with Policy ENV7 of the Islington Unitary Development Plan, since the recent use of the cleared site for car parking is not considered to constitute an appropriate temporary use within the terms of that policy and since the Council considers it unlikely that renewal of the permission would result in the development being carried out in the foreseeable future.
